title: MAFS' Martha Kalifatidis and Michael Brunelli's $1,000-a-night sleek hotel in Mexico's Los Cabos
text:
Married At First Sight's Martha Kalifatidis and Michael Brunelli are currently in Mexico celebrating their one year anniversary of meeting on the reality show.

The power couple have spared no expense for the trip, checking into the state of the art five-star Viceroy Los Cabos hotel in San José del Cabo.

The architecturally stunning concept hotel opened last year, with a single night in one of the mid-range rooms costing a staggering $1,000-a-night.

Vacation! Married At First Sight's Martha Kalifatidis (L) and Michael Brunelli (R) are currently in Mexico celebrating their one year anniversary of meeting on the reality show

With round the clock room service and a high-end gym and wellness centre, the hotspot is the perfect destination for the young lovers to spend time together.

The impressive complex offers crystal clear views of the ocean from every turn.

Perhaps the most striking feature at Viceroy Los Cabos is the Nido restaurant, which is situated in the centre of a 'floating courtyard' with concrete path ways.

Dreamy! The power couple have spared no expense, checking into the state of the art five-star Viceroy Los Cabos hotel in San José del Cabo. Pictured: A balcony inside the hotel

Pricey! The architecturally stunning concept hotel opened last year, with a single night in one of the mid-range rooms costing a staggering $1,000-a-night. Pictured: The pool and beach

Keeping the hotel sleek and modern, Mexican architect Miguel Angel Aragonés used concrete slabs and neutral tones to create a tranquil space.

Instagram influencer Martha wasted no time in striking up a variety of poses around the resort for her 282,000 followers after arriving last week.

She said each concrete slab has 'endless opportunities' for photographs.

Impressive! Perhaps the most striking feature at Viceroy Los Cabos is the Nido restaurant (pictured), which is situated in the centre of a 'floating courtyard' with concrete path ways

Incredible! The hotel offers crystal clear views of the ocean from every turn. Pictured: A suite

'Endless opportunities': Instagram influencer Martha wasted no time in striking up a variety of poses around the hotel for her 282,000 followers after arriving last week

On Sunday, the couple celebrated their one-year anniversary while at the hotel.

'One year, my dear,' wrote Martha, while sharing a picture of herself stood completely naked on their balcony and embracing Michael.

The pair are one of the two remaining couples from Married At First Sight's sixth season, along with Jules Robinson and Cameron Merchant.

Loved up! The couple met filming Married At First Sight in September 2018
description: Married At First Sight's Martha Kalifatidis and Michael Brunelli are currently in Mexico celebrating their one year anniversary of meeting on the reality show.
authors: Joshua Fox For Daily Mail Australia
